intro: Lepidagathis rupestris, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by distinctive, velvety seed heads. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Lepidagathis rupestris is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to tolerate harsh environmental conditions.
